subject: Law
title: Invasive Species Law
description: A quick win: understand Invasive Species Law.

hook.text: Burmese pythons are eating everything in the Everglades. They're not from Florida. Now the law tries to stop them.

buildup.text: Invasive species laws prevent the introduction and spread of non-native plants and animals that harm ecosystems.

discovery.text: The Lacey Act bans trafficking in illegally taken wildlife and plants. Import rules target known invasive species.

twist.text: Once an invasive species establishes itself, eradication is nearly impossible. Prevention is far cheaper than control.

climax.text: Invasive species cost the US over $20 billion per year in damage, control, and lost agricultural productivity.

punchline.text: An ounce of prevention. Invasive species law learned that the hard way.

quiz.question: What does the Lacey Act prohibit?
options: Trafficking in illegally taken wildlife and plants
